designing systems where there's a decreasing concern for the infrastructure the stuff is running on
how it's packaged and also what services you're consuming and where they live it
just becomes a configuration or a string or a connection string and so
microservices tend to have multiple responsibilities that may be quite cohesive it might be an employee or an

in some cases mhm and it might actually be that we can get this promise of code

functions right so the resize image can now be used by a number of other

best practice and then um the way I've seen users over the last two and a half
years use open fars is they're solving real problems and they're doing it in a

principles about what is a stateless and ephemeral workload and then allowing
people to solve problems the way that makes sense for them so generally a
serverless workload or a function is is shortlived it's generally single purpose
has no State between invocations and auto scales for demand now there are
some practical reasons why you may want some state in terms of a connection pool
for a database but the state that I'm talking about there is really things like having particulars in memory a lot
of Monolithic applications would perhaps rely on certain things being established
as Singletons and and knowing that that's there for the next request right in effect it's taking all of that and
